TopicTitle: A small note to the Devs

Articles.Content:
First of all let me just explain that I don't like people. They smell, smear, leak and make too much noise.

I don't like talking to people because most of them are really disagreeable.

I'd like to take each of you guys at squad by your smelly, sweaty hands and shake them.

Even though it would mean touching you... I know.. disgusting.

I'd like to tell you guys something.

Even though you might reply and start a conversation. Well shut-up and listen! I didn't write this for a chat. 

If you feel some need to reply.. keep it short and don't expect a response.

I want to tell you that I love KSP. Best game ever. Played it for longer than any other and I've played a lot cos I'm really really old. The only things I say to people nowadays is usually something like "Get out of my garden!" or "Go and play some where else!" or "Well it's MY ball now!"

I paid for it. not enough, but I paid for it. I think it was less than 20 quid. If you guys bring out any official expansion packs, I'll pay for them too. I'll pay more than I paid for the game. I've been playing it for around three thousand hours and now 1.0 is coming out so there goes a load more of my time.

So thanks Squad. Thanks for making KSP and giving me something to do that doesn't have to involve being sociable. 

Get on those expansion packs. I want to give you more money. 

Starting to feel like I cheated you... 

See what I mean, you guys haven't even replied and you are already making me feel bad.

Well said.. 

Thanks for all the hard work, Squad.
Yep, I don't think I have ever been entertained so well and for so long but for so little money. Except maybe one time in a field in Cornwall but that's not really the same.
A toast to SQUAD! ***Ã¢â‚¬â€¹FOR KERBAL SPACE PROGRAM!***
Well said indeed! Thank you SQUAD!

It's a funny thing isn't it? I've bought several AAA games and I've felt cheated, but I bought KSP in a steam sale for about 12 quid and I feel like I cheated the devs. I totally agree with the OP for wanting to shake hands with the devs, even though it involves physical contact with humans, and give them money. Keep up the excellent work SQUAD!!!!!
